department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
short_summary: Employee assistance program services for employees experiencing personal, health or work-related issues affecting mental health and well-being, issued by Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC).
full_summary:
# Employee Assistance Program Services RFP
==========================================

**Reference number:** WS3615423885-Doc3855190025 (6th Amendment)

**Publication date:** February 2, 2023

**Closing date:** March 17, 2023, 2:00 PM (Eastern Standard Time)

**Description:**
The Department of National Defence (DND) requires an Employee Assistance Program (EAP) to provide support services for employees experiencing personal, health, or work-related issues affecting their mental health and well-being.

**Background:**

The DND is seeking a service provider to offer confidential counseling services, training, and support to employees. The selected contractor will be responsible for providing a comprehensive EAP that addresses the unique needs of DND employees.

**Scope of Work:**

The successful bidder shall provide the following services:

* Employee assistance program services
* Confidential counseling services
* Training and workshops for employees and management
* Support for employees dealing with work-related or personal issues

**Evaluation Criteria:**

The bids will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

* Lowest cost per point
* Quality of services offered
* Experience of the bidder
* References from previous clients

**Contract Information:**

* Expected contract start date: November 1, 2022
* Expected contract end date: Not specified
* Contracting entity: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* End user entity: Department of National Defence (DND)

**Contact Information:**

The contact person for this RFP is:

* Diane Reynolds
* Email: diane.reynolds@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
* URL: http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/15303635?extsite=MTUzMDM2MzVfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

**Acknowledgement:**

By submitting a bid, the bidder acknowledges that they have read, understood, and accepted the terms and conditions of this RFP. Please note that all bids must be submitted electronically through the specified URL. The bidder is responsible for checking their email regularly for any updates or notifications regarding this RFP. The submitter acknowledges that this RFP is a confidential and proprietary information and agrees to maintain its confidentiality.
